page.title: 18The Obelisk
page.content: This is a Large "{CLEOPATRA's Needle" type Obelisk placed at the most Southerly point of the nearby Farnborough Hall's garden.It is a landmark,visible for several miles around and from most points in this grid section. The surrounding gardens are formally laid out and bordered by Laurel bushes,below which is a retaining wall of Limestone supporting the bank upon which the Obelisk stands. Over the years this has become a favourite visiting place for Village yougsters,who have inscribed their names and initials on it for posterity. It is believed to have been erected in 1847 to commemorate the completion of the construction of the picturesque garden walkway at nearby Farnborough Hall.
